security.title: Security & Data Protection
security.subtitle: Security is not an afterthought — even though this is still a very small one-person project. Here’s what I do today to keep your data reasonably safe.

posture.title: Current Security Practices (2026)
posture.authDesc: Supabase Auth (email + password, secure tokens, refresh rotation, rate limiting). No social logins yet.
posture.rlsDesc: Every table uses RLS. Users can only see and modify data belonging to their company.
posture.encryptionDesc: Data in transit: TLS 1.3 everywhere. Data at rest: encrypted by Supabase (PostgreSQL). Sensitive fields (if any) are encrypted client-side where possible.
posture.storageDesc: Supabase Storage with signed URLs, public buckets avoided, file type & size restrictions.
posture.monitoringDesc: Login attempts, failed auth, suspicious activity logged. Basic alerting via email for critical events.

limit.title: Current limitations
limit.desc: No formal SOC 2 yet, no bug bounty program, no external pentests (yet), single developer — so human error is the biggest risk right now.

roadmap.title: Security Roadmap (what comes next)
roadmap.subtitle: As the product grows and brings in revenue, I plan to invest more seriously in security.
roadmap.short1desc: Will enforce for admin roles first, then optional for everyone.
roadmap.medium1desc: Once we have paying customers and meaningful data.
roadmap.long1desc: Invite ethical hackers to find issues with rewards.
roadmap.long2desc: Only when we have enterprise interest and budget.

report.title: Found a security issue?
report.desc: If you discover any security vulnerability — even small — please report it responsibly. I take every report seriously.
report.note: Please do not post vulnerabilities publicly until I’ve had reasonable time to fix them. Thank you for helping keep this safe.

security.footer: This page is intentionally straightforward because the product is still very early. Security will become more formal as we grow and take on paying customers.
security.footer.ps: Thanks for caring about security — it matters to me too.
